solution_line_template: Two-thirds of the tadpoles will survive to become frogs, so {survival_numerator} * {initial_tadpoles} / {survival_denominator} = <<{survival_numerator}*{initial_tadpoles}/{survival_denominator}={surviving_tadpoles}>>{surviving_tadpoles} tadpoles will grow into frogs.
When the tadpoles grow up, there will be {initial_frogs} + {surviving_tadpoles} = <<{initial_frogs}+{surviving_tadpoles}={total_frogs_after_growth}>>{total_frogs_after_growth} frogs in the pond.

The pond can only sustain {pond_capacity} frogs, so {total_frogs_after_growth} - {pond_capacity} = <<{total_frogs_after_growth}-{pond_capacity}={frogs_to_relocate}>>{frogs_to_relocate} frogs will need to find a new pond.
